intro: Spergularia pissisi, commonly known as the pink sandspurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and fleshy, succulent leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pink to reddish flowers with five petals, typically arranged in clusters. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or arid environments. Spergularia pissisi is adapted to withstand drought and high salinity, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions.
